channel.title: American Clerks
channel.description: Do they 100% always ask for I.D when buying alcohol? Everyone on the Internet says different things, some say waiters/waitresses check but don't do the math because it gets them a bigger tip for letting it slip, some say clerks always look and are strict for I.D. The majority of you people here being American and somewhat underage, do they? If so, where does a man get his damn beer from? The age limit is 18 in New Zealand.

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Law wise, they are suppose to. Do they always? Hmm it depends on how old you look I think. I can sometimes walk into a store for example if I don’t shave and I look like I am in my thirties and easily don’t get carded while there are other times if I do shave I look like I am in my twenties I get carded all the time.

It also does go by store. I know the local Pizza Hut in my town they don’t care if you are 90 years old ( literally ) they will card you due to the law.

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Really depends, stores good luck.

Although at this Red Lobster my brother and I went to we both ordered a corona (he is 19, I am 16) he looks the part and well I don’t know about me, I guess I did or she didn’t care. No one asked anything.

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea, it mostly depends on location. Most will ID you unless you look like 30+.

Read full topic

don’t smoke those marijuana doobie reefer blunts like natey or akon_

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Gotta have the connections, there’s places around here that will sell and not ask but you gotta have some sort of relations…

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Don’t do it buddy, alcohol will ruin your life.

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

If you’re buying beer from a store, they will always ask for ID if they don’t know you that well or don’t look the age. If you’re getting alcohol in a restaurant, it’s basically the same. For the most part if it’s your first time buying alcohol they will ask for it no matter what, and after that they won’t.

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Unfortunately no, its just going to be me and a buddy of mine the same age. If you look the part do they ignore asking for I.D? I would assume checking for I.D is some sort of law but just wondering if anyone has bought alcohol underage.

For stores, yes, usually most of the time. You could go to a bad part of town where things are sort of sketch, every state has a certain area like that where clerks don’t care how old you are. Pay some guy $10 to walk in and buy you some, just be sure he’s not an off-duty cop. :l

Read full topic

item.title: American Clerks

item.description:

item.title: American Clerks
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Do you have any relatives/friends that are 21? My teacher told me (I don’t know if it’s true) that some restaurants serve you alcohol even if you don’t have your ID. You can go to a restaurant with a 21+ friend and order a drink and you’d be fine.

Read full topic
